comments: "Numbral" powers of 10 (see A048888 for definition). - _John W. Layman_, Dec 18 2001For n>1, a(n-1) = the (2^n-3)rd coefficient in expansion of th(0)=y, th(n+1)=th(n)*(th(n)+1).a(n)=sum_{i=1...(2^n -1)} i*(i+1)/2. - _Ctibor O. Zizka_, Mar 03 2009
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (10,-16).
formula: a(0) = 1, a(n) = (2^(3n+2) - 2^n)/3 = A059155(n)/12 = A000079(n)*A002450(n+1) = A016203(n+1)-A016203(n). - _Ralf Stephan_, Aug 14 2003a(n) = binomial(2^n,2)*(2^n + 1)/3, n>=1. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jan 07 2008a(n-1) = ((5+sqrt 9)^n-(5-sqrt 9)^n)/6. - Al Hakanson (hawkuu(AT)gmail.com), Jan 07 2009a(0)=1, a(n)=8*a(n-1)+2^n. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 09 2011a(n)=10*a(n-1)-16*a(n-2), n>1. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Feb 09 2011
prog: (Sage) [lucas_number1(n,10,16) for n in xrange(1, 21)]# _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 26 2009(Sage) [(8^n - 2^n)/6 for n in xrange(1,21)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jun 05 2009(PARI) Vec(1/((1-2*x)*(1-8*x))+O(x^99)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 23 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
